intro: Hyperbaena gonavensis, commonly known as the Gonave beauty, is a flowering plant native to the island of Gonâve in the Haitian archipelago. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, pentapetalous flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in coastal and limestone soils, often growing in humid, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
